title.narrative: OPT 4.1. CHILD AND EQUITY FOCUSED PUBLIC POLICIES, FINANCING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: National and sub-national capacities in the four departments receiving UNICEF support are strengthened for the implementation of child- and equity focused policies, efficient and effective use of social investment and the monitoring and reporting on the situation of children., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, especially the most disadvantaged, including those affected by climate change, are prioritized within the national development agenda.

UNIDAD DE ANALISIS DE POLITICAS SOC Y ECONOMICAS

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/404 OCM 4. EVERY CHILD HAS AN EQUAL CHANCE IN LIFE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national capacities in the four departments receiving UNICEF support are strengthened for the implementation ofchild- and equity focused policies, efficient and effective use of social investment and the monitoring and reporting on thesituation of children.

description.narrative: In a year marked by new government administrations, both at national and subnational levels, and the beginning of the government’s new medium-term planning cycle, UNICEF provided technical assistance to strengthen institutional capacity to address the multiple challenges and inequities faced by girls, boys and adolescents. This assistance sought to ensure a childhood perspective in the short- and medium-term planning and in budgeting processes; strengthen formal mechanisms to ensure rights to participation; and support the technical development of national policies such as the Multisectoral Childhood Plan and the Early Childhood Development Policy. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/12/2021
